Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Ioanna T
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 4 friends and we are absolutely satisfied with Florida hotel. First of all, it is in a quiet,clean neighborhood, only 5 minutes on foot from St Peters Basilica, and 15' walking from Rome's city center. If you are not a "walking" guy you can easily take the metro line Ottaviano, just 2 minutes distance from the hotel. In this area there are plenty of trattorias, restaurants, and bars for young people. Moreover, it has the second largest market road (after Via del Corso), and you can spend a whole day shopping only in this area, if you want! As far as the room is concerned,we booked a quadruple which was very clean and cozy. You can pay an additional fee of 5 euros/person if you want to have continental breakfast from the buffet. Staff is very friendly and helpful, so don't hesitate to ask for their help in any problem you might have. We were very pleased with everything provided, and we urge you to choose it for your vacation in the city of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny but clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Anitarita
Reviews.Content: The room was tiny and the bathroom was tinier, but everything was clean, and the receptionists at the desk were friendly, especially Barbara! She directed us to some amazing restaurants, helped us find a bus, etc. The location is great, just a few minutes from the Vatican and not too far from the rest of Rome. Definitely opt for the breakfast buffet in the hotel; it's better and cheaper than anything else we found in the neighborhood. This hotel is more than worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Merrimac54
Reviews.Content: Whist I have not been happy with this hotel, I can honestly review it and say that the staff are friendly, breakfast fair and location very convenient. The rooms are rather small and we had a lot of problems with the hot and cold mixer in our shower, we were either burnt or cooled down. It was not fixed on the second day we complained, we do hope that it is fixed for the last night! Overall, a good hotel that I would recommend. And I have given a 4 star rating because it is nice to have pleasant and friendly reception staff! Ross

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: BeijingCristina
Reviews.Content: Location is great, rooms are spacious and well equiped. Check in and out very quick. Room's furniture could be refreshed and modernized.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Tidy, Quiet, Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Noneslee
Reviews.Content: From looking at the outside, the hotel wasnt much, but inside its lovely, clean and tidy. Rooms are a little small, but certainly livable. Bathrooms decent, and well equipted. We were booked into their affiliated hotel, but they transferred us to Hotel Florida, and i think i prefer H. Florida. Good location, just down from the Vatican. I would suggest if coming to Rome for the 1st time, to stay closer to the tourist attractions (Eurostars near the train station is wonderful) Its a little quiet at night times, and would require a lot more coordination with the bus systems. Excellent stay :)

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and love the location”
Reviews.Author: javajive2
Reviews.Content: The front-desk ladies were great; Rita and Barbara were incredbily friendly and helpful. They were able to assist me with every request; from getting the TV to work to an adaptor for the power socket. I loved the location of the hotel; it was minutes away from the Vatican and shops and restaurants. Although it was a comfortable stay at the hotel, I wished I had booked us into the Superior room instead as the Standard room was rather dated and the shower stall was tiny.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Location Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen M
Reviews.Content: Absolutely delighted with our Visit to Rome and the hotel Florida. We booked last minute when another hotel let us down and got a discount on a superior room. When we arrived we were upgraded at no extra cost to a junior suite which was just newly renovated and had a view over the main street. The hotel is 10 minutes from the vatican and 10 - 15 mins accross the river (which is a pleasant walk) to Piazia Novona. We didnt use the metro at all as Rome is so beautiful you want to be out there enjoying it and the weather was fab.This hotel really was really worth 3 times more than we paid for the 3 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for trip to Rome”
Reviews.Author: YorkiesEngland
Reviews.Content: Hotel in lovely location close to the Vatican. Less than 10 minute walk to the metro, metro was cheap and easy to use. Lots of nice restaurants around the hotel. We had a junior suite which was at the front of the hotel, it was clean, modern and very comfortable. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast not good value or quality. Stay would have been impoved if there were tea and coffee making facilities and sky tv

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: tihane3
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff, clean room, excelent location. Great hotel for this price range.

Reviews.Title: “Would have been perfect bar issues around air conditioning”
Reviews.Author: sheffnexus
Reviews.Content: Easy enough to get to via Metro and simple enough to find, and though on a main road was very quiet - our room was towards the back of the hotel but think that is the case for all the rooms. For an out of centre hotel it was in a good location for some less touristy restaurants, easy access to the Vatican and a shortish (10 mins) walk towards the centre of Rome. The room was very clean, very comfortable, clean towels everyday and the bathroom was clean with an excellent shower. Mini bar and safe, TV though we couldn't find an English channel. Don't bother paying for the breakfast though (at €8 a person) as there is a great coffee bar / shop across the road and eating breakfast Roman style (don't sit down!) at €2 a person in a coffee bar is a much more authentic experience. The staff spoke English and in the main were friendly and helpful. Lots of steps but there was a lift. Due to the time of year we chose to pay extra to stay here because of the air conditioning, but due to their policy of returning the key when leaving the hotel it was not possible to return after a day out to a cool room, as we could not leave the air conditioning on whilst we were out! Some of the staff were willing to let us leave the key in, others were not, which caused a few 'discussions' (!) between us and the staff and slightly tainted our experience as in the end we were not able to have the air-con on whilst away from the hotel which in the heat of a Roman summer is not ideal. We felt this was a shame as other than this the hotel was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite as luxurious as it looks but good stay”
Reviews.Author: misstyg
Reviews.Content: This isn't a luxurious hotel, the rooms are small and cramped with two people in them but it is functional, the maids do a great job and it's very clean, the AC didn't work though. The breakfasts are £5 when you get there and you can say on the morning if you want it, bargin compared to cafes in Rome! It's located on the main shopping street so is in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: PR_advisor
Reviews.Content: This is not a 4 star hotel, but for the price in Rome and the location you can’t asked for more. Safe area, few blocks away from the Ottaviano metro station, across the street from bus stop that will take you directly to the coliseum. Since it is a few blocks away from the Vatican, one night after being in the Trevi fountain, the metro was out of service and was easy to find a bus that went to the Vatican, just by saying to the bus driver “VATICAN”. Very helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: sankits
Reviews.Content: Great location,good room and lovely staff...thats what you want when you are travelling with your loved ones..and this hotel had it all. I traveled with my wife and 20 months old son recently.The staff was very helpful and spoke good english,gave good tips as to how and when to visit the major attractions,even helped us with baby's food and milk. Great location,just minutes away from St.Peters Basilica and big shopping market with plenty of restaurants for a nice evening walk. Highly recommended !! Sandy (UK)

Reviews.Title: “Clean och nice hotell at good value”
Reviews.Author: MrsHanna
Reviews.Content: We, 6 adults, stayed there in april 2011. We got 3 superior rooms at a good price. One room was quite small with a small bed and was more like a single room. Another one was of normal size and the third a little bigger. The rooms were cleaned every day and were overall nice and quiet. The TV had a lot of channels but all were in italian and the superior rooms had mini bar. The location (near Vatican city) was good. A busy street with a lot of shopping oppertunities. We walked all over the city from here insted of using public transportation. It took maybe 20 minutes to the historical centre and about 40 min to Trastevere but we got to see a lot. Restaurants, coffee shops and supermarket in the neighborhood. At an additional cost of 5 euro per person and day you could get a continental breakfast. That included bread, butter, cheese, ham, jam, yoghurt, musli, cereals, juice, fruit, pastries and coffee/cappuccino/tea and more made upon request. The staff was kind and helpful. We were very pleased with Hotel Florida and would stay here again. The weather in early April was great, 27 centigrades and clear sky.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, great location and very helpful and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: LilianMalta
Reviews.Content: Very central, clean and safe area. New clean rooms and very helpful staff. Really enjoyed our stay and we will be back. Only 5 mins walk to Vatican city. Lilian, Malta

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Helpful staff, centrally situated”
Reviews.Author: StanDcar
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights mid Feb. Staff at reception very helpful, gave us advice on where to catch a shuttle bus back to the airport which saved us a quite a bit of money. The hotel is on a busy shopping street but the rooms are quiet and tranquil, once you're in the hotel itself you forget its position.The room was cleaned and the towels changed every day, the hotel itself is lovely and clean.Air condiioning is available free of charge, we needed it to take the chill off at night, remember it was February! It is a ten minute walk to the vatican. The nearest Metro stop is a 5-10 minute walk away. Metro takes you to the Colisseum, the Circus Maximus, Trevi fountain, Spanish steps. Free maps of Rome are available in the Hotel reception, they were a great help. Would thoroughly recommend Rome and would definitely stay in Hotel Florida again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location...Bring Earplugs”
Reviews.Author: travelling_duo5498
Reviews.Content: We came by an early-morning flight so we reached the hotel way before the check-in time. we waited for a couple of hours, and was given a room at 11:15AM (3 hours before the check-in time!). We pre-paid booked the hotel through booking.com with our confirmation slip saying "VAT and city tax not applicable" so we were surprised that we were made to pay 2 euros per person per night for city tax! The receptionist said it is a new policy. I reasoned that I had pre-paid my reservation a month before our stay but there was no way the key will be given to us until we pay the city tax. By the way, don't expect a hotel. Hotel Florida is more of an "inn". It is on the second floor of a building with other tenants. There is one lift servicing the whole building. The superior room was nice. It has enough space for 2 big suitcases and a small trolley that we had. The bathroom was ample. It was clean except for the sheets that gave me bug bites all over. I complained, and it was changed. It was okay from then on. There is no chance for room service but in-room breakfast can be requested for 5 euros per person. We loved the hotel's proximity to the Vatican, the Metro and the restaurants. It is situated in a busy shopping district. The receptionists, special to Barbara, are nice and accommodating. They even took care of booking our outgoing airport-shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Unhelpful Unpleasant Owner”
Reviews.Author: BekANDRoy
Reviews.Content: The location is close to a lot of tourist attractions and is peaceful and quiet in the evenings. lots of gorgeous cafes and market shopping and also close to st peters square where you can catch all tourist buses and get all the information you need. On arrival the reception staff was more then halpful and we booked into our room on the lower level to reception. you cannot get broadband connection from this floor, they says its available but the receptioin to my laptop was crap and kept cutting out. we were really exhausted from flying for 3 days from australia and stopping over in london and really needed some sleep and rest. the rooms next to us had problems with its bathroom and had workmen using jackhammers and machinery and sledge hammering the wall plus talking to each other over the top of it all. its was unbearable. the main wall of our room was the one getting worked on it caused me a thumping headache. i went upstairs where i was told by the hotel owner herself to "deal with it", the bathroom needs repairing. this upset me as we had booked and paid months in advance and found this unfair that we werent even advised of this work taking place when we checked in. i stated this to her where she pretty much dismissed even as i was on the brink of tears, i was so exhausted. she left me there and made her poor receptionist come out an tell me that i had to pay an extra fee for a room upgrade per night we were there. i was beside myself. i refused to do so as i was not my fault that her bathroom needed repairs and she then said i can have a room upgrade for one night only. i refused again to lug my luggage up and down floors after one night and was in tears by this stage from getting treated so poorly, and she didnt seem to care and just dismissed me. what a welcome to rome!! her receptionist then followed me to the lower level stating that we can have a room upgrade for the stay (2 nights) that we were there. what a drama. i dont recommend anyone to stay at this hotel, besides the lovely accommodating reception staff, there was nothing pleasant about our stay after this incident.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for a visit to Rome”
Reviews.Author: MamaJojo123
Reviews.Content: I had read a number of unfavourable reviews about this hotel in the Vatican area, and was unsure about what to expect, but decided to give it a go based on its location and price. I asked the hotel to arrange for transportation from the airport to the hotel so taht we would not have to figure it out upon arrival, never having been to Rome before. We arrived in Rome after a long flight from Toronto quite tired but excited. As soon as we got out of the gates, there was a driver waiting for us holding a sign with our last name. We approached him, dragging our bags behind us. The driver did not speak English, which did not matter to us, we understood to follow him to get to our ride. The man barrelled out of the airport so fast that we had trouble keeping up to him. We didn't want to lose him in the crowd of people so we practically ran to make sure we didn't get lost. Once we got to the mini van, we piled in our things and were rushed to finish quickly. One word of advise - PUT ON YOUR SEAT BELT!! Unfortunately, we didn't. The drivers in Rome are absolutely insane. As we got closer to heavier traffic, the driver swerved, sped and braked as though we were in a Formula 500 race. At one point, he braked so suddenly that my daughter and I literally "flew" across the seats. I did hurt my knee, but didn't dare speak up, as the driver had at that point stopped the van and was yelling out the door at other people. Not sure exactly what had happend, but it was all very loud and heated. Finally we reached our destination, where he waited for us to retrieve our bags and then sped away to continue his race. Once at the hotel, we had to buzz to get into the building, and then up 2 flights of stairs to the reception. Yes there was a small, very old lift, but there were 3 of us and 3 sets of bags, so we opted to climb. The receptionist was lovely! She told us they had noticed that it was my husbands birthday the next day, so they gave us a complimentary upgrade to a superior room. The room itself was nice - clean and new and quite good for European standards. The staff at this hotel absolutely went out of their way to be helpful and pleasant. They booked us our Vatican tour, helped us with maps and just all the little things that make your stay pleasant. Housekeeping did a great job every day we were there. The hotel was walking distance to most things and the metro was close by. I loved staying there because there was not the whole hustle of the centre of Rome, but you could get to everything easily. Tons of restaurants and cafe's nearby for amazing food and people watching. Even a small farmers market just steps from the hotel. I would most certainly return to hotel Florida!

Reviews.Title: “fit our needs, clean & good location”
Reviews.Author: Erika510
Reviews.Content: we (a couple, mother and aunt) stayed here to be close to Vatican area. It is a block or 2 away. there are stores, restaurants all within a short walking distance. we were happ with our stay here. we did not use this place for more than just sleep and a shower, we were out & about those 3 days enjoying Rome. for US standards and what we are accustomed to the room is as big as our living room. We had a queen and 2 twin beds (we booked a quadruple) and of course the bathroom is tiny, but it was clean and efficient service.

Reviews.Title: “For us--Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: LAA24
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed almost a week at the hotel, we thought it was great. The rooms were decent sized, hot water in the showers and CLEAN! Cleanliness is one of the most important things to me and this hotel met my standards. The staff is very helpful and was able to communicate with us in Spanish and English, since we don't speak Italian. The location is great, 5 minutes to the vatican and within walking distance to all the main sites in the city center. There isn't internet and the TV is only available in Italian, but for us it wasn't a problem.

Reviews.Title: “FLorida Hotel, Be careful”
Reviews.Author: JairoUdh
Reviews.Content: We select this Hotel, based on strategic position (nearby Vaticano) and previous Internet Review, Once there (we arrive one day late becuase of Transportation Issues) we found a good room distribution but not internet services, not TV, and changes on our room reservation, Also, we experienced a bad time at the time we did checkout, becuase not body tell us about having early check out (11:00 AM) and then, after having pay two days and using only one night; We end-up paying extra 100 euro and having bad time with extra discussion with Hotel Manager as well as Police, (many people tell me about Italy warnings but this case wasn't fear et all), Then, Hotel room is not bad, very good resturant for taking breakfast at front (you have to do it staying in front of service) but be carefull on clarify check out time, internet service and rates, In my opinion, more valuable if you decide to take another option, nearby metro and a little bit out of Vaticano (for getting better price/service), Basically, this is only Bed Hotel, becasue Breakfast is at the front, having no any additional support or service, Important Note, Access to Hotel is through Stairs or a very old elevator having limited access (only two people) or limiting size/weigths on your bags, Regards Jairo

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our needs-- highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: tkinnama
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our stay at the Florida. The rooms were small but not too small, and they were clean and modern, too. Location is great-- short walks to St. Peter's and Vatican Museums, longer walks to Piazza Navona and Trastavere. Not the most touristy part of town, but lots of restaurants and cafes nearby. With the reasonable price, this was perfect for us.

Reviews.Title: “Consider Other Options”
Reviews.Author: brownkey
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Florida for two nights and were disappointed. The room was fairly clean overall, but this was the most expensive hotel on our whole stay yet the least enjoyable. The bathroom walls and ceiling were covered in mold and our toilet seat was held together with old, moldy packing tape. The shower stall would not be able to accommodate anyone too overweight. We are low-maintenance travelers and don't spend much time in our hotel room (thankfully) but we probably wouldn't stay here again. The location, however, is great since it is so close to the Vatican. Our room was relatively quiet and I felt safe there. The front desk staff was also very friendly and helpful. They spoke English and provided free maps for sightseeing all over Rome.

Reviews.Title: “'very european”
Reviews.Author: LindaandEmily
Reviews.Content: This is a clean, very convenient, and friendly place to stay in Rome. I am in my 60s, and travelled alone. Staff was very helpful, and the owner arranged a tour of the Vatican museum where I did not have to wait in line for hours. Well worth the money if you can get over the American idea that the hotel is why you are there!

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place, but a little shadey.”
Reviews.Author: mrFleet
Reviews.Content: Hotel Florida had a great location for the Vatican Area, with plenty of shopping and dining nearby. A good walk to the old city, but certainly doable. (We did it a lot!) Beds were comfortable enough, and the bathroom was clean. Service wasn't great though. They didn't have our reservation written down when we got there, so luckily there was a room open. Also, the guy running the telephone service computer at the front desk didn't schedule our wake up call properly. So when we were lucky we had packed up the night before so when I woke up to see our airport van was coming in five minutes, we could get out the door quickly! Also it's on the fourth floor of a building, so it wasn't a cinch to find. There's an outdoor gate that is open during the day, but locked at night. Expect to wait to be buzzed in if you arrive after dark.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: captcor
Reviews.Content: Hotel occupies several floors of larger building. Easy walk to Vatican, busses and underground. USO also an easy walk for those eligible. Hotel is non smoking. Small rooms are very clean and nicely furnished. Picture on eurocheapo.com is accurate. Our room was without bath, but the bath just steps from our door was upscale and spotless. Host Alex was a delight and very helpful as was desk staff. No breakfast was served. Nearby garage was quite expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: StellaLasVegas_NV
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights at Hotel Florida. The best thing it has going for it is the location--so close to the Vatican and the bus stop a block away either goes to or connects easily to virtually every other major tourist site in Rome. There is no breakfast, but two or three places close by, so not really a problem. The rooms were very clean and reasonably spacious. The shower was the smallest we encountered in our three weeks in Italy--don't drop the soap! Good value as far as Rome prices go and the desk people were always friendly and eager to help--looked up bus routings for us on their computer, recommended restaurants, made reservations at the Vatican Museums and Gardens. Overall, a good experience and good value.

Reviews.Title: “Yuck-ola!”
Reviews.Author: indigo1925
Reviews.Content: We arrived here and were greeted by a surley reciption who charged us over the price we thought we would have to pay. We were to stay at BBSusy where we had spent the first 3 nights of our trip (went to Umbria for the second half) but they over booked and stuck us here! The room we had was three floors down from the recption. The elevator was out of service. The room we had was tiny (which is normal) but was VERY dirty, shabby, and worn. The bathroom was scary, very tiny, very mouldy, and the shower backed up and ran all over the floor. When we pointed out big water stains all over the carpet (I'm allergic to mould) the reception guy blew us off and said that all other rooms were booked and we could not swap. Maybe that was the case, but at least admit that there was water all over the floor! The reciption that we were told was 24 hours was closed when we got up very early in the am. There was a power outage all over the country. Thank goodness we didn't allow them to keep our passports like they wanted to. I mean if they are 24 hours, why have the door locked to the reciption with out any lights or buzzer??? They also had to be reminded three times to call a cab for us for our early moring departure. All in all, good location (but a very busy loud street), but lousey service, dirty nasty rooms. I would avoid this place at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Reservation Doesn't Guarantee Room!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I reserved a room for three nights at Hotel Florida for the end of May 2005. I reserved the room by phone and the hotel even sent me an email with our correct arrival date. After a long day of travel, we arrived at the hotel only to be told they expected us the night before and had given away our room. After showing the desk clerk the email, he said they made a mistake but there was nothing they could do. Their rooms were now fully booked!! He did however find us another room at a nearby hotel, though our first night there was spent without air-conditioning and it was very hot. So don't be sure you'll have a room at Hotel Florida, even if you have a credit card confirmed reservation and a correct email confirmation.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Little Hotel - Lovely Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March 2004 on the advice of our neighbour who knows Rome well. Travel agent didn't want to book us in because it was a 2 star hotel. Rooms small but clean and functional. Great location. Just around the corner from the Vatican. Right in the middle of high end shopping district. Close to subway stations and within walking distance of a lot of attactions.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: fritzchris
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay. We first stayed here in 1998 and have been coming back ever since. The hotel owner "Alex" is very helpfull and will provide useful information for Rome. The rooms are smallish, but charming. Immaculate and very clean with private bath and shower. No breakfast is offered so go across the street to the wonderful pastry shop and grab a connolli and capuccino. Great location, close to Metro stop "Ottiviano" and Vatican. Nice area where shopping is excellent.

HotelInfo.Name: Florida
HotelInfo.Address: Via Cola di Rienzo 243, 00192 Rome, Italy
